stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Mulberry
[Gender] Female
[Combat Experience] None
[Place of Birth] Yan
[Date of Birth] Jun 26
[Race] Liberi
[Height] 158cm
[Infection Status]
Originium crystals lightly distributed across surface of body, confirmed Infected by medical examination.

[Physical Strength] Normal
[Mobility] Normal
[Physical Resilience] Normal
[Tactical Acumen] Normal
[Combat Skill] Normal
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Normal

Member of the Yan disaster relief organization 'Chun-qian,' primarily carrying out relief efforts in some colder regions of Yan prone to Catastrophe. After enrolling in Chun-qian's exchange project with Rhodes Island, was selected for her outstanding application, and accepted dispatch to Rhodes Island to study Oripathy and relevant aid knowledge. Outside of study, also serves as an interim operator assisting the Medical Department.

Imaging tests show the indistinct outlines of internal organs, obscured by abnormal shadows. Originium granules detected in the circulatory system. The subject is confirmed to be infected with Oripathy.

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 7%
Slight visible Originium crystallization around lower torso.

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.22u/L
Operator Mulberry situates for long periods in danger regions with high risk of infection. In spite of a relatively strong protective awareness and excellent grasp of treatment skills, she still requires regular examination to avoid her condition worsening.

Rhodes Island's exchange and study program with relief organization 'Chun-qian' is a new project, with Rhodes Island principally offering anti-Oripathy protective methods in emergency situations, as well as focused treatment measures for the onset stage and other such subjects—these studies are a specialty of Rhodes Island, while also being essential for Catastrophe relief crew.
Having been passed stringent tests and selection processes, there's no cause to doubt Mulberry's ability in her specialty field.

On first arrival at Rhodes Island, Mulberry's behavior was a cause for concern. She was reserved with words, shy and timid, carrying books as she went about on her own. Though she had fine marks on her language tests, she was incapable of smoothly starting and holding conversations with other operators.
This was no small issue, but fortunately, some Rhodes Island operators from Yan quickly picked up on the circumstances of this new girl—people from Yan always tend to be extremely close with others from the same region, and with everyone's encouragement, Mulberry finally took her first step, working up the courage to chat with a few Catastrophe Messengers staying at Rhodes Island.
And so long as a window for communication is left open, there's no need to worry.

Born to a traditional family in Jiangqi City, Yan, Mulberry was the youngest girl of her generation in the household. Her academic record at school was considered above average; despite her intense efforts studying, she was never able to rank at the top. She felt a sense of dejection and disappointment, her character growing increasingly introverted alongside.
Whether in her teachers' or her family's eyes, the earnest, hard-working, clever and amenable Mulberry was a sweetheart who put others at ease. Not too individualistic, not quite outstanding, but meek, untroublesome, didn't overstep her bounds—the picture of a good child.
Mulberry's mother and father long had plans for their daughter's future; they hoped Mulberry would receive a sound and fine education, then find a safe, stable job, and live what, to an ordinary person, would be a calm and fulfilled life. But against everyone's expectations, the obedient-since-birth, rarely self-expressive Mulberry went against the norm. She didn't heed her family's arrangements, but instead, following her graduation, delivered her resume to 'Chun-qian' without telling her family, and went far away from home.
As one would imagine, this unprecedented rebelliousness of hers caused a huge commotion in her family. But just as Mulberry had written in her farewell letter to her parents, ever since witnessing the tragedy of a Catastrophe in her youth, she had secretly fostered her own ambitions, and only in this regard was she unwilling to defer to her elders' plans.
The girl summoned the greatest courage of her life, and set out to decide her future for herself.

Mulberry is very reserved, to the point of almost cowardice. When going to bed at night, if she isn't hugging an old doll from home, she'll be unable to fall asleep. And it's because of her anxiety that she always has, purportedly very effective, protective charms hung all over her personal belongings. At most times, the impression she gives is introverted, timid, careful and cautious, gentle yet frail. But when involved her field of specialty, Mulberry will temporarily throw off all cowardice and hesitation. At these times, as a relief worker, for the sake of those she's saving, she has to become reliable.
The resolve and self-confidence Mulberry displays during her work can surprise any operator working with her for the first time.

Mulberry's parents' expectations were for her to have a smooth and steady life, but with her Oripathy infection, such expectations are now wild dreams.
Perhaps, when leaving home, Mulberry felt discontent with her family's plans, and rebelled against their control. But after joining the relief squad, after wrapping herself in a standard sleeping bag and knowing the sensation of her extremities frozen numb; listening to the gale outside her tent, alone, too scared to even sleep the whole night; at the height of the wind's howls, furtively shrinking out of homesickness into her sleeping bag to weep, letting the sound of the wind cover her own sobs... after going through all that, her varieties of discontent, of complaints and rebellion, all dissipated into unimportance.
But happily, in her second year with the squad, Mulberry—gradually accustomed to the arduous work life—restored normal relations bit by bit with her family. One time while on her way to visit home, Mulberry witnessed her father, who had been so vehemently opposed to her joining a relief organization, holding a letter she'd sent, standing at the corner of his street, mentioning her name to the neighbors.
'This is work that saves people! Our girl's not scared of a hard time. Good on her!'
That proud look never shown to her before, spread across her ever-strict father's face, is a sight Mulberry reckons she'll remember forever.

Everyone knows what a disaster relief worker faces after a Catastrophe.
Before she made the decision to leave home, Mulberry already understood that choosing to be a relief worker is to choose an inevitably trying, challenging way of life. Many disasters... especially Catastrophes that induce serious Originium calamity, not only gravely impact the lives of those who live in the disaster zone. Those who head in to make the rescue are also enduring one rigorous trial after another.
No matter how strictly you prepare gear in advance, things can slip through the cracks. Active year-round in Catastrophe zones, rescuing those affected, there are times workers even face a sudden second disaster. In a profession as hazardous as a relief worker's, Oripathy infection is very hard to avoid.
The moment you choose this line of work, you've already chosen to set own your safety aside.
Of course, this much is true for Mulberry.

trait.overrideDescription: Restores the HP of allied units and recovers <$ba.dt.element>Elemental Injury</> by <@ba.kw>{ep_heal_ratio:0%}</> of ATK (can recover <$ba.dt.element>Elemental Injury</> of unhurt allied units)

skins.description:
An outfit commonly worn by Operators.
While not as practical as a uniform, it's what they find most comfortable.

An outfit that has been improved after the Operator's Promotion.
Custom-made to suit each Operator's experiences and needs, these outfits are designed to provide them maximum flexibility on any battlefield. Furthermore, this is all done without compromising the comfort that they've come to expect.

<color name=#ffffff>EPOQUE Series New Release/Plant Crude Drug. Practical outfit worn by Mulberry for both relief and horticultural work, with enough pockets for all her tools. Green trimmings adorn the simple fabric, representing verdant life.</color>

0011 New Arrivals/Reflection That of the Moons. Made by Lungmen tailors, inspired by the waterscapes of Jiangqi, the delicate cuts and soft gauze represent the reflection of the lotus in water when the moon is out.

skills.desc:

<@ba.rem>Can store up to {cnt} charges</>

modules.desc:
Operator Mulberry has demonstrated a remarkable aptitude for wide-range healing in tandem with remedying Operators of their accrued Elemental Injurys.
The Field Operations Department has thus passed the following resolution:
This operator shall be appointed a Medic Operator during field operations to exercise Wandering Medic responsibilities.
In witness whereof,
This badge is hereby conferred upon the above named.

Ning-Ning,
Have you been eating and sleeping well lately? In your last letter, you mentioned often waking up startled at night, which has made us very worried. Your second sister has been transferred to work in Danyan, and she went up the mountain there and picked some nerve-soothing herbs for you. She plans to send them to you via a Messenger—has your address changed recently? If it has, please write back soon to let us know your new address. Or maybe she can ask the Chun-qian team to contact Rhodes Island's office and give the herbs to them. Which way works better for you?
As for what you asked about in your last letter, your dad has already looked into it for you. Thankfully no one was hurt in the snowstorm last month. Your dad carried the disaster-prevention pamphlets you sent back and handed them out door-to-door. The teachers at the local school read those pamphlets and even praised your writing, saying your wrist strength has greatly improved. When he told me this, I felt really happy for you, but when the night falls, I still can't help but feel a bit sad. Ning-Ning, my girl, you're far from home now. When you sit at the desk writing and studying until your fingers are all sore, you wouldn't be able to run over to me for a good massage... All I can do is remind you to rest well in my letters. You've always been a smart child, and now you've even learned much about saving lives. I'm sure you know better how to take good care of yourself, right?
Oh, I have a funny story to share with you. The festival is coming up next week, and not only are the kids excited about the rice dumplings and snacks, even Grandma is thrilled. When the weather is nice, she likes to do some needlework on her lounge chair, but her eyesight isn't great, so she always needs help threading the needle. One afternoon, when I got back home from work, she complained to me that she had called for you many times in the morning, but you never came. I didn't know how to explain it to her; it was both funny and a bit sad. I took the afternoon off that day and made two sachets with Grandma. Actually, I've never really sewed anything before, so my stitching came out all crooked—you'll probably recognize which one I made at first glance. Or you can tell it by its smell. I filled it with some dried acanthopanax root, the same herb we used to put under your pillow to help calm your mind. Hang the sachet by your bed and it should give off a gentle scent that might help you sleep better.
Your dad and I agreed to cooperate on this letter and it was supposed to start with me writing and then your dad finishing it. But he sat there chewing on the end of his pen half the night without writing a single word. With the Messenger arriving at dawn, I decided to just finish it myself. Everything at home is going well, and both your dad and I are doing fine at work. Whenever people talk about you, they always praise how strong and brave you are. Your father and I have read your last letter over and over again.
If you have the time, maybe send another letter home?

voice_lines.voiceText: Doctor, I'll leave the files I sorted here. Oh, you don't have to thank me. I am used to it, and it's nothing difficult... Um, are you thirsty perhaps? Should I make you some tea?

I'm not very good at speaking any languages other than Yanese. That's why I was a little scared at first and didn't talk much. But everyone's very friendly, and there are a lot of people from Yan here. Phew... it really puts my mind at ease.

Sorry to disturb you, Doctor, but would you happen to know where Provence and everyone else went? My family sent me some goodies from back home, and I thought I'd share some with them since they've been taking care of me... Oh, there are some for you too, Doctor. Please have a taste!
Doctor, could you help me look for my little dumpling? It's the small black-and-white doll. I thought I'd left it here, but I can't find it... *Whimpers*, please, I can't sleep at night without it.

The rescue team has to deal with the Catastrophes a lot, so it's only a matter of time for us before we become infected. None of us reject anyone because of that. The crystallization on my body isn't very conspicuous, and it doesn't hurt even if you press down on it... Sometimes, I even forget that I have this on my body.

When I first joined the rescue team, I wasn't very used to the climate or the food there. I'd get too homesick to fall asleep at night, and I cried to myself many, many times, but whenever I see the people we rescued, I start to think that maybe I can keep at it...

Doctor, sorry to bother you... I've been studying Oripathy prevention techniques during Catastrophe relief, and Tsukinogi suggested that I come ask for your advice... Um... Sorry, am I being a bother?

Uhh! Doctor, why would you sneak up on me like that? Huh? What am I holding? Oh, this is a letter I got from home. When I made the decision to leave, my parents were so angry that they said they would disown me, but there's a saying where I come from: Blood is thicker than water...

When I got infected with Oripathy, I knew I probably wouldn't be able to live the peaceful life my parents wanted for me. I don't regret it, though... Besides, if I hadn't made my decision, I would never have met you or anyone else from Rhodes Island here and now, hehe.
Doctor? Doctor? Sorry to bother you. Please lift your head up a little and sleep with the cushion. If you fall asleep like this, the letters from the report will get all over your face...

Hello, I'm a member of the Yan disaster relief organization 'Chun-qian,' dispatched here as an intern. My name is... Oh, I-I'm sorry. We need to use our codenames here, right? I'm terribly, terribly sorry. Please call me Mulberry.
Uhh..The mountain collapsed, and the ground crumbled...! They're not special effects from an action movie, are they?
Huh? A promotion? Really? I get a salary from Rhodes Island as well as Chun-qian?! I... I'm so happy...!
This time, I'm not doing this to help someone else, I'm doing it for myself... Doctor, thanks for always being there to cheer me on. Now, I'm sure that everything that I've done is truly meaningful.
I'll do my best to support everyone!
Huh? Me as team captain? Ah... Are you sure?
Okay, we'll head out right away... Everyone, please stay safe. We'll meet again once this is over.
Watch out, everyone! There's movement up ahead!
Safety goggles... Okay, I have mine on. Let's go!
Phew... Haah! Oh, I'm here! I-I'm not nervous!
Preparing rescue...!
Rescue team Mulberry in position!
Everyone, please be careful!
I... I can do it too!
Where are you looking? It's dangerous to get distracted!
It's my job to ensure everyone's safety!
Report! All rescue operations in the area have been completed. Evacuation and escort proceeding without issue! Phew, thank goodness nobody's hurt...
Phew, that wraps up the operation. Doctor, was I helpful?
Wait! It's not safe that way... We have to do something. I'll go fetch them right away!
It's not safe here! Everyone, please evacuate! Doctor, follow me!
Whoa, this is the staff dormitory... Um, will I need to pay rent?
Huh? Ah! I'm sorry! I'm sorry!
Doctor! I really appreciate it, but please stop trying to sneak any more amulets onto me... I have way too many already!
Arknights.

Happy New Year, Doctor. I didn't expect to spend the New Year here at Rhodes Island. It feels...fresh. Actually, it's been a few years since I've been home for the New Years because of work. I really want to go back, even if I can only see my home from far away...
Hello, Doctor. Do you have work today too?

Doctor, happy birthday... I'd like to ask, ever since I gave you that amulet, did any of your wishes happen to come true...? N—No? Then... do you have any wishes for your birthday, that I can make real?

So many doctors aboard Rhodes Island are Infected themselves. Rescue workers who can't protect themselves properly... they're not a rare sight to see. But these rescuers still choose to walk towards disaster, realizing the risk and taking it in. Their conviction is most precious. I hope that our effort can help more people live in peace.

building_skills.desc: When this Operator is assigned to the HR Office, HR contacting speed <@cc.vup>+10%</>, Morale consumed per hour <@cc.vup>-0.25</>
When this Operator is assigned to the HR Office, HR contacting speed <@cc.vup>+20%</>, Morale consumed per hour <@cc.vup>-0.25</>
When this Operator is assigned to the HR Office, for every Recruit slot (Default slots do not count), <<$cc.bd_b1><@cc.rem>Worldly Plight</></> <@cc.vup>+10</>
